message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IT, cs.ST, cs.SY 

The paper discusses a machine learning problem and proposes a Bayesian approach to learning appropriate bias for an environment of related tasks. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the sub-category of Machine Learning (cs.LG). Additionally, the paper discusses the concept of prior distributions, which is a common topic in Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI). The paper also mentions information theory and provides bounds on the amount of information required to learn a task, which suggests that it could belong to the sub-category of Information Theory (cs.IT). The paper also discusses the dimensionality of the true prior, which is a topic in Statistics (cs.ST). Finally, the paper proposes a model for learning in an environment of related tasks, which suggests that it could belong to the sub-category of Systems and Control (cs.SY).
